dt: {bc}either of the 10th pair of cranial nerves that arise from the medulla oblongata and supply chiefly the viscera especially with autonomic sensory and motor fibers

et: borrowed from New Latin {it}vagus nervus{/it}, literally, "wandering nerve,"; so called from its multiplicity of connecting points in the neck, thorax, and abdomen {ma}{mat|vague|}{/ma}
shortdef: either of the 10th pair of cranial nerves that arise from the medulla oblongata and supply chiefly the viscera especially with autonomic sensory and motor fibers —called also vagus
